text: Ann Zeilinger Caracristi (February 1, 1921 â€“ January 10, 2016) was an American cryptanalyst. She was the former Deputy Director of the National Security Agency,Former Deputy Directors NSA website. where she served at many positions over a 40-year career. She served as a member of the Secretary of Defense Joint Security Commission and President's Foreign Intelligence Advisory Board. She became the first woman at NSA to be promoted to GS-18 rank, in 1975. She was born in Bronxville, New York. In 2002, her name was given to a Naval Intelligence Professionals' award.Ann Caracristi Award on the Naval Intelligence website Caracristi died January 10, 2016, in Washington, D.C. from complications of dementia at the age of 94. ==References== Category:1921 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Deaths from dementia Category:Disease- related deaths in Washington, D.C. Category:NSA people Category:Scientists from New York (state)
title: Ann Z. Caracristi
